title: Requires all mortgage brokers to be licensed, establishes certain education requirements, and establishes a mortgage broker licensing exam
summary: Requires all mortgage brokers to be licensed, establishes certain educational requirements, and directs and authorizes the superintendent to establish a mortgage broker licensing exam.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2225

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. GIBSON -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Banks

       AN  ACT  to amend the banking law, in relation to requiring all mortgage
         brokers to be licensed, establishes certain  educational  requirements
         through  rules  and  regulations promulgated by the banking board, and
         directs and authorizes the  superintendent  to  establish  a  mortgage
         broker licensing exam

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (a) of subdivision 2 and subdivision 3 of section
    2  590 of the banking law, as amended by chapter 472 of the laws  of  2008,
    3  paragraph  (c)  of  subdivision 3 as added and paragraphs (d) and (e) of
    4  subdivision 3 as relettered by chapter 507 of  the  laws  of  2009,  are
    5  amended to read as follows:
    6    (a)  No  person, partnership, association, corporation or other entity
    7  shall engage in the business of making [five or more] mortgage loans  in
    8  any  one calendar year without first obtaining a license from the super-
    9  intendent in accordance with the licensing procedure  provided  in  this
   10  article  and such regulations as may be promulgated by the banking board
   11  or prescribed by the superintendent.  The licensing provisions  of  this
   12  subdivision shall not apply to any exempt organization nor to any entity
   13  or  entities  which  shall  be  exempted  in accordance with regulations
   14  promulgated by the banking board hereunder.
   15    3. Rules and regulations. In addition to such powers as may  otherwise
   16  be  prescribed  by  this chapter, the banking board is hereby authorized
   17  and empowered to promulgate such rules and regulations  as  may  in  the
   18  judgement  of  the banking board be consistent with the purposes of this
   19  article, or appropriate for the effective administration of  this  arti-
   20  cle, including, but not limited to:
   21    (a)  Such  rules  and regulations in connection with the activities of
   22  mortgage brokers, mortgage bankers, mortgage loan servicers  and  exempt

    1  organizations  as may be necessary and appropriate for the protection of
    2  consumers in this state;
    3    (b)  Such rules and regulations as may be necessary and appropriate to
    4  define improper or fraudulent business practices in connection with  the
    5  activities  of  mortgage brokers, mortgage bankers, mortgage loan servi-
    6  cers and exempt organizations in making mortgage loans;
    7    (c) Such rules and regulations under this article regarding the origi-
    8  nation, sale or servicing of manufactured home loans as may be necessary
    9  and appropriate for the protection of consumers;
   10    (d) Such rules and regulations [as may define the terms used  in  this
   11  article  and as may be necessary and appropriate to interpret and imple-
   12  ment the provisions of this article]  ESTABLISHING  MINIMUM  EDUCATIONAL
   13  REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL MORTGAGE BROKERS; and
   14    (e) Such rules and regulations as may be necessary for the enforcement
   15  of this article.
   16    The  banking  board  is  hereby  authorized and empowered to make such
   17  specific rulings, demands and findings as it may deem necessary for  the
   18  proper conduct of the mortgage lending industry.
   19    S  2. Subdivision 1 of section 592-a of the banking law, as amended by
   20  section 18 of part D1 of chapter 109 of the laws of 2006, is amended  to
   21  read as follows:
   22    1.  Upon  the filing of an application for registration, if the super-
   23  intendent shall find that the APPLICANT HAS MET ALL EDUCATIONAL REQUIRE-
   24  MENTS ESTABLISHED BY THE BANKING BOARD, HAS  FURNISHED  PROOF  THAT  THE
   25  APPLICANT  HAS  PASSED  THE  LICENSING  EXAMINATION FOR MORTGAGE BROKERS
   26  ESTABLISHED BY THIS ARTICLE,  AND  THAT  THE  financial  responsibility,
   27  experience,  character, and general fitness of the applicant, and of the
   28  members thereof if the applicant is a co-partnership or association, and
   29  of the officers and directors thereof if the applicant is a corporation,
   30  are such as to command the confidence of the community  and  to  warrant
   31  belief  that  the  business will be operated honestly, fairly, and effi-
   32  ciently within the purpose of this  article,  the  superintendent  shall
   33  thereupon  register  the  applicant as a mortgage broker on a roll main-
   34  tained for that purpose at the banking department, and issue  a  certif-
   35  icate attesting to such registration in duplicate. If the superintendent
   36  shall not so find, the superintendent shall not register such applicant,
   37  and  shall  notify the applicant of the denial. The superintendent shall
   38  transmit one copy of such certificate to the applicant and file  another
   39  in  the  office  of the banking department. Upon receipt of such certif-
   40  icate a mortgage broker shall be authorized to engage in the business of
   41  placing, processing and negotiating mortgage  loans.  Such  registration
   42  shall  remain  in  full  force and effect until it is surrendered by the
   43  licensee or revoked or suspended as hereinafter  provided,  except  that
   44  such registration, notwithstanding any provisions of subdivision five of
   45  section seventeen of this chapter to the contrary, shall expire upon the
   46  registrant's  failure to pay the required assessment charged pursuant to
   47  such section seventeen thirty days after the date or dates such  payment
   48  or payments are due. If the registrant fails to pay such charged assess-
   49  ment  by  the  date  or dates such payment or payments are due, then the
   50  registrant shall be required to pay, in addition,  a  late  fee  in  the
   51  amount  of one hundred dollars. Such registration shall be reinstated if
   52  the registrant pays such assessment charged and any applicable late fees
   53  and/or interest within sixty days of such expiration. The superintendent
   54  shall approve or deny every application for registration hereunder with-
   55  in ninety days from the  filing  of  a  complete  application  provided,

    1  however,  that  failure to act within the prescribed period shall not be
    2  deemed approval of any such application.
    3    S  3. The banking law is amended by adding a new section 592-b to read
    4  as follows:
    5    S 592-B. MORTGAGE BROKER LICENSING EXAMINATION. THE SUPERINTENDENT  IS
    6  HEREBY  DIRECTED AND AUTHORIZED TO ESTABLISH A MORTGAGE BROKER LICENSING
    7  EXAMINATION AND SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND  REGULATIONS  REGARDING  SUCH
    8  EXAMINATION,  INCLUDING  BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE TIME, DATE AND MANNER IN
    9  WHICH SUCH EXAMINATION SHALL BE GIVEN.
   10    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
